author: yuga.eth
content: If anybody has Geth 1.10.5 dev release running, could they provide a JSON output of fee_history API for any block on Ropsten? Thank you!

author: alexssd7fp
content: For a mining pool, what kind of things we would need to change to support EIP-1559?

author: pietjepuk
content: I don't think there's anything special about this particular hard fork, so just upgrading your respective clients should do.

author: alexssd7fp
content: So the full transaction fees are still awarded to miners? o.O

author: rishabh42
content:
Greetings everyone,
I'm interested to know what implications will the EIP-1559 update have on my currently deployed DApp on the mainnet?
Would any changes be required on the current UI? 

Would be grateful if anyone could help me on this 
Thanks in advance

author: pietjepuk
content: The bare minimum is to just upgrade your clients to a London fork supporting version. There is no requirement to do anything else.

author: alexssd7fp
content: I mean, what are the changes in the rewards?

author: pietjepuk
content: I would say that you could eventually change miner payouts to use EIP-1559 style transactions instead, but you don't _have_ to do that

author: pietjepuk
content: let's move this over to <#692078615269212180> btw, this is more for core devs

author: alexssd7fp
content: Oh ok

author: barnabemonnot
content: thank you perema! this is super cool

author: ajsutton
content: Miners need to double their target gas limit at the fork block because with 1559 the target is for blocks to be 50% full. The gas limit automatically doubles when the fork activated but if the gas target isn’t changed it will gradually be voted back down effectively halving capacity.

author: alexssd7fp
content: That’s for supporting the network

author: alexssd7fp
content: But what about supporting the actual mining pool?

author: alexssd7fp
content: Also lower gas limit means less uncles

author: alexssd7fp
content: And a smaller AWS bill
